skill.name: scikit-bio
skill.description: Biological data toolkit. Sequence analysis, alignments, phylogenetic trees, diversity metrics (alpha/beta, UniFrac), ordination (PCoA), PERMANOVA, FASTA/Newick I/O, for microbiome analysis.
skill.summary: Biological data toolkit. Sequence analysis, alignments, phylogenetic trees, diversity metrics (alpha...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns were found. The content is documentation and examples for scikit-bio APIs.

content.value_statement: You need a reliable toolkit for sequence, diversity, and phylogenetic analysis. This skill guides scikit-bio workflows with clear examples and best practices.
actual_capabilities: Read and write FASTA, FASTQ, and Newick formats
Run pairwise and multiple sequence alignments
Compute alpha and beta diversity metrics
Perform ordination with PCoA and CCA
Run PERMANOVA, ANOSIM, and Mantel tests
limitations: Requires scikit-bio installed in the Python environment
Does not perform raw sequencing quality control
Does not generate publication-ready plots by itself
Large datasets may need subsampling for memory limits

use_cases.title: Profile community diversity
use_cases.description: Compute alpha and beta diversity and run PERMANOVA for group comparisons.

use_cases.title: Build phylogenetic trees
use_cases.description: Create trees from distance matrices and compare topologies with RF distance.

use_cases.title: Analyze embeddings
use_cases.description: Convert protein embeddings to distance matrices and ordination results.

prompt_templates.title: Read FASTA and translate
prompt_templates.prompt: Read a FASTA file into scikit-bio, translate DNA to protein, and save the protein to a new FASTA file.

prompt_templates.title: Compute alpha diversity
prompt_templates.prompt: Calculate Shannon and Faith PD for a counts table with sample IDs and a phylogenetic tree.

prompt_templates.title: Run PCoA and PERMANOVA
prompt_templates.prompt: Compute Bray Curtis distances, run PCoA, and test group differences with PERMANOVA.

prompt_templates.title: Tree build and compare
prompt_templates.prompt: Construct a neighbor joining tree from a distance matrix and compare it to another tree with Robinson Foulds distance.

output_examples.input: Compute Bray Curtis beta diversity and summarize group separation
output: PCoA shows clear separation of two treatment groups
PERMANOVA p value is below 0.05, suggesting group differences

best_practices: Use generators for large sequence files to reduce memory use
Keep sample and feature IDs consistent across tables and trees
Save distance matrices and ordination results for reuse
anti_patterns: Running phylogenetic metrics without matching OTU IDs
Using relative abundances where counts are required
Loading massive files fully into memory

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with my Python setup
faq.answer: It requires scikit-bio installed and works with standard Python environments.

faq.question: What are the limits for large datasets
faq.answer: Very large files may need generators or subsampling to avoid memory errors.

faq.question: Can I integrate results with pandas or QIIME 2
faq.answer: Yes, it supports pandas DataFrames and BIOM artifacts used in QIIME 2.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data or credentials
faq.answer: No, it only provides local analysis guidance and examples.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot ID mismatch errors
faq.answer: Check that sample and feature IDs match across tables, trees, and metadata.

faq.question: How does this compare to general Python libraries
faq.answer: It focuses on bioinformatics workflows like diversity, trees, and alignments.
